Education and Home ( Leaderboard Top ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 3,000 scholarships open for poor ARMM students By Mayen Jaymalin (The Philippine Star) | Updated January 5, 2017 - 12:00am 
MANILA, Philippines – Three thousand scholarship grants are open to poor but deserving students from the Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (ARMM), the Technical Education Skills and Development Authority (TESDA) announced yesterday. 
TESDA director general Guiling Mamondiong said Mindanao State University (MSU) has allotted 3,000 scholarships as part of its support for the Comprehensive Reform and Development Agenda (CRDA) program of the Duterte government. 
TESDA and MSU have forged a memorandum of cooperation for the full implementation of the CRDA in ARMM and other Mindanao regions. 
Under the scholarship program, selected poor students from ARMM can avail of free tuition, dormitory and other university facilities. 
According to Mamondiong the memorandum of cooperation between TESDA and ARMM is expected to facilitate the progress of CRDA which will help uplift the lives of residents in the region. 
“This is a golden opportunity, particularly for the people of Mindanao. We have now a sincere President who comes from Mindanao. He knows very well the problems in Mindanao, especially the Bangsamoro, and how to solve it,” Mamondiong said. Homepage ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
Mamondiong said Duterte’s reform and development agenda is realistic and attainable. 
As an academic institution of higher learning, MSU is sharing of the technical and professional skills of the university, as well as its facilities to effectively carry out Duterte’s CRDA program. 
TESDA and MSU plan to organize the “First Bangsamoro Peace Summit” at the International Convention Center of MSU Campus, Marawi City on Feb. 5. 
President Duterte will be invited as guest speaker for that historic summit to be attended by all sectors of society in the ARMM and Regions 9, 10 and 12. Homepage ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
